text_result.title: MedlinePlus 			Medical Encyclopedia Common cold
text_result.fulltxt:
<ul>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong>     			 			 				 Return to top The common cold generally involves a runny nose nasal congestion and sneezing You may also have a sore throat cough headache or other symptoms Over 200 viruses can cause a cold Causes     			 			 				 Return <strong>  . . .</strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> colds are most common during the rainy season When someone has a cold their runny nose is teeming with cold viruses Sneezing nose-blowing and nose-wiping spread the virus You can catch a cold by inhaling the virus if you are sitting close to<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> the virus if you are sitting close to someone who sneezes or by touching your nose eyes or mouth after you have touched something contaminated by the virus People are most contagious for the first 2 to 3 days of a cold and usually not<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 </ul>

 <li><strong>. . . </strong>     			 			 				 Return to top Rhinoplasty is surgery to repair or reshape the nose See also Septoplasty Description     			 			 				 Return to top Rhinoplasty can be performed under local or general anesthesia depending on the exact procedure <strong>. . . </strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> procedure usually takes 1 -2 hours but may take longer With local anesthesia the nose and the area around it is numbed You will probably be lightly sedated but awake during the surgery relaxed and not feeling pain General anesthesia allows the<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 </ul>

text_result.title: MedlinePlus 			Medical Encyclopedia Choanal atresia
text_result.fulltxt:
<ul>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong>     			 			 				 Return to top Newborns with this condition are known as obligate nose breathers This means the baby must breathe through its nose because the oral airway is not yet developed enough to allow for frequent mouth breathing In fact a<strong>  . . .</strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> almost the only time an infant with choanal atresia does not breathe through its nose is when crying Choanal atresia may affect one or both sides of the nasal airway Choanal atresia blocking both sides bilateral of the nose causes acute<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> and breathe at same time Inability to pass a catheter through each side of the nose into the throat Persistent one-sided nasal blockage or discharge Exams and Tests     			 			 				 Return to top A physical examination may show an obstruction o<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 </ul>

text_result.title: Septoplasty MedlinePlus Medical Encyclopedia
text_result.fulltxt:
<ul>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> is surgery to correct any problems in the nasal septum the wall inside the nose that separates the nostrils See also Rhinoplasty Description     			 			 				 Return to top Most patients receive general anesthesia before septoplasty This wi<strong>  . . .</strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> home the same day Your surgeon will make a cut inside the wall on one side of your nose The mucus membrane that covers the wall will be lifted up Then your surgeon will remove or move any cartilage or bone that is causing the blockage in the area<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> To repair a crooked bent or deformed nasal septum that blocks the airway in your nose People with this condition usually breathe through their mouth and get infections on their nose Uncontrollable nosebleeds To repair a hole in the nasal septum<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 </ul>

text_result.title: MedlinePlus 			Medical Encyclopedia Septal hematoma
text_result.fulltxt:
<ul>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> A septal hematoma is a bruise or bleeding within the nasal septum The septum of the nose separates the two nostrils Causes     			 			 				 Return to top A broken nose or any soft tissue injury to the area may cause a septal hematoma This can occur <strong>  . . .</strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> Tests     			 			 				 Return to top Your health care provider will look into your nose to see if there is soft tissue swelling in the area separating the two sides of your nose Gentle touching with an applicator or Q-tip will show that the area is<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> over the hematoma Once the blood is removed gauze or cotton is placed inside the nose Outlook Prognosis     			 			 				 Return to top If this injury is treated in a timely fashion you can expect full healing Possible Complications     			 			 <strong>. . . </strong></li>
 </ul>

text_result.title: MedlinePlus 			Medical Encyclopedia Cleft lip and palate
text_result.fulltxt:
<ul>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> notch in the lip to a complete groove that runs into the roof of the mouth and nose These features may occur separately or together Risk factors include a family history of cleft lip or palate and other birth defect About 1 out of 2,500 people<strong>  . . .</strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> It may also be a complete split in the lip that goes all the way to the base of the nose A cleft palate can be on one or both sides of the roof of the mouth It may go the full length of the palate Other symptoms include Misaligned teeth Change in<strong>. . . </strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> Exams and Tests     			 			 				 Return to top A physical examination of the mouth nose and palate confirms a cleft lip or cleft palate Medical tests may be done to rule out other possible health conditions Treatment     			 			 				 Return to top <strong>. . . </strong></li>
 </ul>
